result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter G Hamilton

records.addlTxt:
Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Peter G Hamilton in court, in custody.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. In court today for cases 22CF2515, 22CM1976 and 22CM2112 regarding the defendants wish to represent himself. Mr. Hamilton answers questions of the court. DE is sworn in to answer questions. 

The Court held a colloquy with the defendant prior to approving his waiver of counsel to ensure he was waiving his rights competently, deliberately, and voluntarily.  The court apprised the defendant of his right to counsel, of the advantages of counsel, and of the difficulties and disadvantages of self-representation.  The Court also apprised the defendant of the nature and elements of the charges and the range of possible penalties upon entry of a guilty plea.  Based on this colloquy, the Court does not find the DE is able to represent himself. 

DE is instructed to contact the public defenders office to apply for an attorney. DE given information to apply and the case numbers he needs to apply for. Court will set a status conference for 60-90 days out.
Status conference scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on January 6, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 700 block of State St in Madison. 
- Defendant shall not be at the UW Bookstore. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

1:33 PM Defendant Peter G Hamilton in court, in custody.  Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides in court for Peter G Hamilton.  Prosecuting attorney Timothy Robert Verhoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on October 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
